rare-candy.name: Rare Candy
rare-candy.description: Increases level of a Pokémon by 1.

rarer-candy.name: Rarer Candy
rarer-candy.description: Increases all party members' level by 1.

pp-up.name: PP Up
pp-up.description: Permanently increases PP for one Pokémon move by 1 for every 5 maximum PP (maximum 3)

pp-max.name: PP Max
pp-max.description: Permanently increases PP for one Pokémon move by 3 for every 5 maximum PP (maximum 3)

bashful-mint.name: Bashful Mint
bashful-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Bashful (Neutral).

docile-mint.name: Docile Mint
docile-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Docile (Neutral).

hardy-mint.name: Hardy Mint
hardy-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Hardy (Neutral).

quirky-mint.name: Quirky Mint
quirky-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Quirky (Neutral).

serious-mint.name: Serious Mint
serious-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Serious (Neutral).

adamant-mint.name: Adamant Mint
adamant-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Adamant (+Atk/-SpAtk).

brave-mint.name: Brave Mint
brave-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Brave (+Atk/-Spd).

lonely-mint.name: Lonely Mint
lonely-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Lonely (+Atk/-Def).

naughty-mint.name: Naughty Mint
naughty-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Naughty (+Atk/-SpDef).

bold-mint.name: Bold Mint
bold-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Bold (+Def/-Atk).

impish-mint.name: Impish Mint
impish-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Impish (+Def/-SpAtk).

lax-mint.name: Lax Mint
lax-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Lax (+Def/-SpDef).

relaxed-mint.name: Relaxed Mint
relaxed-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Relaxed (+Def/-Spd).

modest-mint.name: Modest Mint
modest-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Modest (+SpAtk/-Atk).

mild-mint.name: Mild Mint
mild-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Mild (+SpAtk/-Def).

quiet-mint.name: Quiet Mint
quiet-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Quiet (+SpAtk/-Spd).

rash-mint.name: Rash Mint
rash-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Rash (+SpAtk/-SpDef).

calm-mint.name: Calm Mint
calm-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Calm (+SpDef/-Atk).

careful-mint.name: Careful Mint
careful-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Careful (+SpDef/-SpAtk).

gentle-mint.name: Gentle Mint
gentle-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Gentle (+SpDef/-Def).

sassy-mint.name: Sassy Mint
sassy-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Sassy (+SpDef/-Spd).

hasty-mint.name: Hasty Mint
hasty-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Hasty (+Spd/-Def).

jolly-mint.name: Jolly Mint
jolly-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Jolly (+Spd/-SpAtk).

naive-mint.name: Naive Mint
naive-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Naive (+Spd/-SpDef).

timid-mint.name: Timid Mint
timid-mint.description: Changes a Pokémon's nature to Timid (+Spd/-Atk).

linking-cord.name: Linking Cord
linking-cord.description: Kadabra→Alakazam, Machoke→Machamp, Graveler→Golem, Alolan Graveler→Alolan Golem, Boldore→Gigalith, Haunter→Gengar, Onix→Steelix(Must know a Steel type move), Scyther→Scizor(Must know a Steel type move), Clamperl→Huntail, Clamperl→Gorebyss, Feebas→Milotic, Gurdurr→Conkeldurr, Phantump→Trevenant, Poliwhirl→Politoed, Pumpkaboo→Gourgeist, Slowpoke→Slowking, Karrablast→Escavalier(Must have caught or hatched Shelmet at least once)

sun-stone.name: Sun Stone
sun-stone.description: Gloom→Bellossom, Sunkern→Sunflora, Cottonee→Whimsicott, Petilil→Lilligant, Helioptile→Heliolisk, Exeggcute→Alolan Exeggutor

moon-stone.name: Moon Stone
moon-stone.description: Nidorina→Nidoqueen, Nidorino→Nidoking, Clefairy→Clefable, Jigglypuff→Wigglytuff, Skitty→Delcatty, Munna→Musharna

leaf-stone.name: Leaf Stone
leaf-stone.description: Gloom→Vileplume, Weepinbell →Victreebel, Hisuian Voltorb→Hisuian Electrode, Exeggcute→Exeggutor, Eevee→Leafeon, Nuzleaf→Shiftry, Pansage→Simisage

fire-stone.name: Fire Stone
fire-stone.description: Vulpix→Ninetales, Growlithe→Arcanine, Hisuian Growlithe→Hisuian Arcanine, Eevee→Flareon, Pansear→Simisear, Capsakid→Scovillain

water-stone.name: Water Stone
water-stone.description: Poliwhirl→Poliwrath, Shellder→Cloyster, Staryu→Starmie, Eevee→Vaporeon, Lombre→Ludicolo, Panpour→Simipour

thunder-stone.name: Thunder Stone
thunder-stone.description: Pikachu→Raichu (Does not evolve cosplay Pikachu), Magneton→Magnezone, Eevee→Jolteon, Nosepass→Probopass, Eelektrik→Eelektross, Charjabug→Vikavolt, Tadbulb→Bellibolt

ice-stone.name: Ice Stone
ice-stone.description: Alolan Sandshrew→Alolan Sandslash, Alolan Vulpix→Alolan Ninetales, Eevee→Glaceon, Galarian Darumaka→Galarian Darmanitan, Crabrawler→Crabominable, Cetoddle→Cetitan

shiny-stone.name: Shiny Stone
shiny-stone.description: Togetic→Togekiss, Roselia→Roserade, Minccino→Cinccino, Floette→Florges, Pikachu→Alolan Raichu

egg-voucher.name: Egg Voucher
egg-voucher.description: Lets you spin the gacha once.

egg-voucher-plus.name: Egg Voucher Plus
egg-voucher-plus.description: Lets you spin the gacha 5 times.

egg-voucher-premium.name: Egg Voucher Premium
egg-voucher-premium.description: Lets you spin the gacha 10 times.Cannot be found in anyEndless Mode.

dna-splicers.name: DNA Splicers
dna-splicers.description: Fuses 2 party members together. See(Here)for more info.

tera-shard.name: Tera Shard
tera-shard.description: Changes one party member's typing to the tera type for 10 rounds.

apicot-berry.name: Apicot Berry
apicot-berry.description: Raises Sp. Def if HP is below 25%.

enigma-berry.name: Enigma Berry
enigma-berry.description: Restores 25% HP if hit by a super effective move.

ganlon-berry.name: Ganlon Berry
ganlon-berry.description: Raises Defense if HP is below 25%.

lansat-berry.name: Lansat Berry
lansat-berry.description: Raises critical hit ratio if HP is below 25%.

liechi-berry.name: Liechi Berry
liechi-berry.description: Raises Attack if HP is below 25%.

leppa-berry.name: Leppa Berry
leppa-berry.description: Restores 10 PP to a move if its PP reaches 0.

lum-berry.name: Lum Berry
lum-berry.description: Cures any non-volatile status condition and confusion

petaya-berry.name: Petaya Berry
petaya-berry.description: Raises Sp. Atk if HP is below 25%.

salac-berry.name: Salac Berry
salac-berry.description: Raises Speed if HP is below 25%.

sitrus-berry.name: Sitrus Berry
sitrus-berry.description: Restores 25% HP if HP is below 50%.

starf-berry.name: Starf Berry
starf-berry.description: Sharply raises a random stat if HP is below 25%.

light-ball.name: Light Ball
light-ball.description: Doubles Attack and Special Attack forPikachu.Can also appear if one of your party members knows the move Fling.

eviolite.name: Eviolite
eviolite.description: “This mysterious evolutionary lump boosts the Defense and Sp. Def stats when held by a Pokémon that can still evolve.”Only appears if you have unlocked the achievement 'Bring Your Child To Work Day'. Only appears if one or more party members are not fully evolved, with a weight of 10.Has no effect on Gigantamaxed Pokémon.

reviver-seed.name: Reviver Seed
reviver-seed.description: “Revives the holder for 1/2 HP upon fainting from a direct hit.”In addition, this removes all stat changes as would normally happen when a Pokémon is KO'd and is one time use. Current circumstances where the Pokémon is not revived include: taking indirect damage, getting hit by an OHKO move, Weather Damage, and using Self Destruct or another similar move.

golden-punch.name: Golden Punch
golden-punch.description: “Grants 50% of damage inflicted as money.”Cannot be found in the rewards screen on wave 199 of Classic and Challenge modes.

flame-orb.name: Flame Orb
flame-orb.description: “Burns its holder at the end of the turn if they do not have a status condition already.”In addition, if one type of orb is held, another cannot be applied. Only appears if a party member has Facade, Trick, Switcheroo, Fling, Psycho Shift, Magic Guard, Guts, Quick Feet, Marvel Scale, or Flare Boost, with a weight of 10

toxic-orb.name: Toxic Orb
toxic-orb.description: “Badly poisons its holder at the end of the turn if they do not have a status condition already.”In addition, if one type of orb is held, another cannot be applied. Only appears if a party member has Facade, Trick, Switcheroo, Fling, Psycho Shift, Magic Guard, Guts, Quick Feet, Marvel Scale, Toxic Boost, or Poison Heal, with a weight of 10

leek.name: Leek
leek.description: Increases crititcal-hit ratio by 2 stages forFarfetch'd,Galarian Farfetch'dandSirfetch'd.Only appears ifFarfetch'd,Galarian Farfetch'dorSirfetch'dare in your party

mystical-rock.name: Mystical Rock
mystical-rock.description: Increases the duration of the holder's terrain and weather by +2.Only appears if a party member has Drizzle, Orichalcum Pulse, Drought, Sand Stream, Sand Spit, Snow Warning, Electric Surge, Hadron Engine, Psychic Surge, Grassy Surge, Seed Sower, Misty Surge, Sunny Day, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, Snowscape, Hail, Chilly Reception, Electric Terrain, Psychic Terrain, Grassy Terrain or Misty Terrain, with a weight of 10.

baton.name: Baton
baton.description: “Allows passing along effects when switching Pokémon, which also bypasses traps.”The Baton transfers to the switched pokémon after use.

focus-band.name: Focus Band
focus-band.description: “Adds a 10% chance to survive with 1 HP after being damaged enough to faint.”

grip-claw.name: Grip Claw
grip-claw.description: “Upon attacking, there is a 10% chance the foe's held item will be stolen.”This effect works per hit with attacking moves that hit more than once.

quick-claw.name: Quick Claw
quick-claw.description: “Adds a 10% chance to move first regardless of speed (after priority).”

kings-rock.name: King's Rock
kings-rock.description: “Adds a 10% chance an attack move will cause the opponent to flinch.”Does not apply effect if the move used already has a chance to flinch the opponent.

leftovers.name: Leftovers
leftovers.description: “Heals 1/16 of a Pokémon's maximum HP every turn.”

form-change-item.name: Form Change Item
form-change-item.description: “Causes certain Pokémon to change form”.Can only appear if you have a party member that can use them, these are various items for changing the form of your Pokémon, for example: Mega Stones, Max Mushrooms, Rusted Sword, Rusted Shield, a full list of these can be foundon this pageor on theFull Item Pool. Cannot be stolen.

soul-dew.name: Soul Dew
soul-dew.description: “Increases the influence of a Pokémon's nature on its stats by 10% (additive).”

scope-lens.name: Scope Lens
scope-lens.description: “It boosts the holder's critical-hit ratio by 1 stage.”

multi-lens.name: Multi Lens
multi-lens.description: “Converts 25% of damage from the holder's attacks into an additional strike.”Multi-Hit attacks are not affected by Multi LensTwo-turn attacks are not affected by Multi Lens. This is true even in conditions that allow them to skip their usual charge turn requirement, such as using Solarbeam in Harsh Sunlight for example.

mini-black-hole.name: Mini Black Hole
mini-black-hole.description: “Every turn, the holder acquires one held item from the foe”Not available by default. Cannot be stolen.

lucky-egg.name: Lucky Egg
lucky-egg.description: “Increases the holder's gain of EXP. Points by 40%.”

golden-egg.name: Golden Egg
golden-egg.description: “Increases the holder's gain of EXP. Points by 100%.”

golden-poke-ball.name: Golden Poké Ball
golden-poke-ball.description: Adds 1 extra item option at the end of every battle.

map.name: Map
map.description: Allows the player to choose their nextbiomefrom any possible option(s).

amulet-coin.name: Amulet Coin
amulet-coin.description: Increases money rewards from all sources by 20%.

lock-capsule.name: Lock Capsule
lock-capsule.description: Allows you to lock item rarities when rerolling items.

candy-jar.name: Candy Jar
candy-jar.description: Increases the number of levels added by Rare Candy items by 1.

exp-all.name: EXP. All
exp-all.description: Non-participants receive 20% of a single participant's EXP. Points.

exp-charm.name: EXP. Charm
exp-charm.description: Increases gain of EXP. Points by 25%.

super-exp-charm.name: Super EXP. Charm
super-exp-charm.description: Increases gain of EXP. Points by 60%.

golden-exp-charm.name: Golden EXP. Charm
golden-exp-charm.description: Increases gain of EXP. Points by 100%.

shiny-charm.name: Shiny Charm
shiny-charm.description: Dramatically increases the chance of a wild Pokémon being Shiny.

ability-charm.name: Ability Charm
ability-charm.description: Dramatically increases the chance of a wild Pokémon having a Hidden Ability.

iv-scanner.name: IV Scanner
iv-scanner.description: Allows scanning the IVs of wild Pokémon.

berry-pouch.name: Berry Pouch
berry-pouch.description: Adds a 30% chance that a used berry will not be consumed.

healing-charm.name: Healing Charm
healing-charm.description: Increases the effectiveness of HP restoring moves and items by 10% (excludes Revives).

catching-charm.name: Catching Charm
catching-charm.description: Increases the chance of getting a critical catch.
